posts.name: Mason
posts.cooked: Our team (number 9453, Mount Vernon Robotics) recently upgraded to Kraken X60 motors. We’re experiencing an error code that flashes red, then orange, then blank. While one side is blank, the other side flashes red and orange. We’ve compared this flashing pattern to the error codes, and the closest match indicates damaged hardware or no CAN communication.

posts.name: Alex Weiss
posts.cooked: I’d be thinking maybe the blank side is broken and the right side is flashing indicating damaged hardware. Is this happening with any of your other Kraken’s or just this one? I’d reach out to where you bought them as they would probably be under warranty.

posts.name: Mason
posts.cooked: Our robot has 8 Krakens in total, 7 are flashing this same error. One has a different error that we know how to solve.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: Is the flashing consistent or is it sporadic? It’s possible you have an unstable CAN bus and it’s swapping rapidly from BAD CAN and GOOD CAN ? Plug a single device into your roboRIO CAN and confirm good orange LEDs, then work from there?

posts.name: Mason
posts.cooked: The flashing is consistent. We plugged in just our gyroscope into the CAN bus and nothing changed. The gyroscope is flashing the same color combo (we haven’t checked what the orange red means in this case). We are using a new Power Distribution Hub and all the motors are new too. The robo rio is an older hand me down from another team.

posts.name: Dalton
posts.cooked: Can you share a video of the flashing LEDs?

posts.name: Glenn Murphy
posts.cooked: Any word on this? we’re having the exact same issue.

posts.name: Mason
posts.cooked: We bought and installed adaptors, and that fixed the broken hardware light warning and now we’re just having can bus error lights.

posts.name: Glenn Murphy
posts.cooked: So we had the same issue and IDing the motors helped. They were all numbered zero, or 1 as they come stock, cant remember which it was. Once they were ID’d everything was good.
